> 10-bit JavaScript Computer

[![Build Status][travis-shield]][travis-url]
![npm package][npm-ver-link]

## μ _Mu_
## Install

```sh
npm install mujs
```

## Summary

μ is a 10-bit JavaScript computer simulation built from [nand][nand] gates using the [g8][g8] library and the [Nu][nu] CPU.

## Usage

See [here][nudocs] to learn how to program the CPU.

```js
const Mu = require("mujs")
const mu = new Mu()

//  Multiply 6 x 7
mu.rom = [
  "0000000000", //    a = @r0
  "1110000000", //    m = 0
  "0000000110", //    a = 6
  "1101000011", //    x = a
  "0000000001", //    a = @r1
  "1110000010", //    m = x
  "0000000111", //    a = 7
  "1101000011", //    x = a
  "0000000010", //    a = @r2
                // loop:
  "1110000010", //    m = x
  "0000000000", //    a = @r0
  "1100000011", //    x = m
  "0000000001", //    a = @r1
  "1100001100", //    x = x + m
  "0000000000", //    a = @r0
  "1110000010", //    m = x
  "0000000010", //    a = @r2
  "1100001011", //    x = m - 1
  "1110000010", //    m = x
  "0000001010", //    a = @loop
  "1000100010", //    x > 0 jump
  "0000000000"  //    a = @r0
]
do {} while (mu.next())
console.log(mu.memory("0000000000"));
// Log 0000000000101010
```

## Other Resources

* [nand2tetris][nand2tetris]
* [_g8_][g8] Logic gates via closures in JS.
* [_nu_][nu] 10-bit CPU.
* [craft][craft] Assembler for mu. __Under construction.__
